introduction_japanese: 暴れる。子どもが泣いて手足を大きく動かすときや、酔った人がさわぐときに使います。
introduction_english: あばれる. We use this when a child cries and flails around, or when a drunk person makes a scene.
meaning_explanation_japanese: 力いっぱい乱暴に動くことです。人や動物が手足をふりまわしたり、ものをこわしそうにしたりする感じです。
meaning_explanation_english: It is an intransitive ru-verb (ichidan). あばれる means to move or behave violently, like to rampage or struggle, often with wild body movement or loss of control.
youtube_description: Learn how to use あばれる: meanings, easy examples, and everyday collocations. Short, clear, beginner-friendly Japanese.

common_words: 暴走（ぼうそう）: reckless driving; rampage

kanji_explanation: The only kanji means violent force and sudden outburst. You see it in ぼうりょく and ぼうそう. It often carries a rough, out-of-control feeling. Think of power bursting out all at once.
synonyms: 荒れる : あれる : get rough; be wild
騒ぐ : さわぐ : make a racket; make a fuss
synonym_explanation: The most common synonyms of the word are あれる and さわぐ. あれる overlaps when things get rough or wild, and さわぐ overlaps when people make loud, restless noise. あばれる is stronger and more physical, with wilder movement.
antonyms: 落ち着く : おちつく : calm down
静まる : しずまる : become quiet
antonym_explanation: The most common antonyms of the word are おちつく and しずまる. These show calming or quieting down, the opposite of wild, out-of-control movement in あばれる.
